title: Minify JavaScript using uglifyjs
body_html:
About UglifyJS

UglifyJS is a JavaScript parser/compressor/beautifier toolkit. It can be used to combine and minify JavaScript assets so that they require less HTTP requests and make your site load faster. UglifyJS is best known as a JavaScript minifier. Minification is a valuable performance enhancing technique as it removes whitespace and unnecessary characters within a file to make it smaller and thus, load faster.

Installing UglifyJS

UglifyJS is available as an Node.js npm module and can be installed using npm. First, you need to install Node.js. Afterwards you can install UglifyJS using npm:

$ npm install -g uglify-js

Usage Options

There are myriad of usage options available in UglifyJS. Here are the usage options: Minify options, Parse options, Compress options, Mangle options, Output options. If you need a quick reference to each option, please check the following link: uglifyjs2

Examples

To help demonstrate the effectiveness of using a minifier on a JavaScript file, we’ll go over a couple of examples using the CLI. For this example, we’ll use a copy of Jquery-3.3.1.js. The CLI command we’ll use for starters is the following:

uglifyjs jquery-3.3.1.js --output jquery-3.3.1.min.js
